ci_support_linux_64_python3.10.____cpyth:
c_stdlib:
- sysroot
c_stdlib_version:
- '2.17'
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
cxx_compiler:
- gxx
cxx_compiler_version:
- '14'
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9
pin_run_as_build:
  python:
    min_pin: x.x
    max_pin: x.x
python:
- 3.10.* *_cpython
target_platform:
- linux-64

about.description:
Coord is a Python module that provides basic functionality related to angles
and celestial coordinates. It is similar in functionality to the
astropy.coordinates module, but with more of an emphasis on efficiency. Some
functions are more than 100 times faster than the corresponding
functionality in astropy. On the other hand, the API is somewhat more
restrictive than the API used by astropy, so the appropriate module to use
will depend on your needs.
about.summary: A Python module for handling angles and celestial coordinates.

raw_meta_yaml:
{% set name = "LSSTDESC.Coord" %}
{% set version = "1.3.1" %}
{% set sha256 = "60f878c29e1f30a9b50bf60dca3c466dc9cfb2cbc71f0a27c575ced969de57ab" %}

package:
  name: {{ name|lower }}-split
  version: {{ version }}

source:
  fn: {{ name }}-{{ version }}.tar.gz
  url: https://pypi.org/packages/source/{{ name[0]|lower }}/{{ name|lower }}/lsstdesc_coord-{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: {{ sha256 }}

build:
  number: 0
  skip: true  # [win]

outputs:
  - name: {{ name|lower }}
    version: {{ version }}
    script: build_pkg.sh
    requirements:
      build:
        - python                                 # [build_platform != target_platform]
        - cross-python_{{ target_platform }}     # [build_platform != target_platform]
        - cffi                                   # [build_platform != target_platform]
        - {{ compiler('cxx') }}
        - {{ stdlib("c") }}
      host:
        - python
        - setuptools
        - pip
        - cffi
      run:
        - python
        - numpy
        - future
        - cffi
    test:
      files:
        - tests.py
      imports:
        - coord
      commands:
        - $PYTHON tests.py

  - name: {{ name|replace('.', '-')|lower }}
    version: {{ version }}
    requirements:
      host:
        - python
      run:
        - python
        - {{ pin_subpackage("lsstdesc.coord", exact=True) }}
    test:
      files:
        - tests.py
      imports:
        - coord
      commands:
        - $PYTHON tests.py

about:
  home: https://github.com/LSSTDESC/Coord
  license: MIT
  license_file: {{ environ["RECIPE_DIR"] }}/LICENSE
  summary: A Python module for handling angles and celestial coordinates.
  description: |
    Coord is a Python module that provides basic functionality related to angles
    and celestial coordinates. It is similar in functionality to the
    astropy.coordinates module, but with more of an emphasis on efficiency. Some
    functions are more than 100 times faster than the corresponding
    functionality in astropy. On the other hand, the API is somewhat more
    restrictive than the API used by astropy, so the appropriate module to use
    will depend on your needs.
  doc_url: https://lsstdesc.github.io/Coord/
  dev_url: https://github.com/LSSTDESC/Coord

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - beckermr
    - rmjarvis
